Title:
Victoriomyces antarcticus gen. et sp. nov.: a distinct
evolutionary lineage of the Cephalothecaceae (Ascomycota) based on DNA
sequences of nuclear genes, and morphological traits
Journal:
International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary
Microbiology
Keywords: new genus and species; Cephalothecaceae; phylogeny
Abstract:
We propose a new genus, Victoriomyces, with a new species,
Victoriomyces antarcticus, isolated from soil samples of Victoria Land,
Antarctica. To determine its taxonomic status and evolutionary
relationships, a phylogenetic analysis was performed on DNA sequences
from nuclear loci, assessing both ribosomal RNA and protein coding
genes. Bayesian inference and Maximum likelihood analyses based on the
18S rDNA, 28S rDNA, and the second largest subunit of RNA polymerase II
(RPB2) gene sequences were used to estimate phylogenetic relationships.
V. antarcticus constitutes one wellÂ–supported distinct lineage within the
Cephalothecaceae (family incertae sedis in Sordariomycetes), in which
the only recognised anamorphs belong to Acremonium and Phialemonium.
Victoriomyces antarcticus can be clearly distinguished from these two
genera by means of a DNA sequence and morphological trait analysis. The
type strain of V. antarcticus is FBL 165T (MUT 3686 T); an additional
strain of the species is FBL 577. The MycoBank number is MB 823713 for
the genus and MB 823714 for the species.
